newsitem.title: JAPAN: Murdoch, Softbank head meet Japan telecom official.
newsitem.headline: Murdoch, Softbank head meet Japan telecom official.

text.p: Media tycoon Rupert Murdoch and Softbank Corp president Masayoshi Son held talks with a top official of Japan's Posts and Telecommunications Ministry on Tuesday about their planned TV satellite broadcasting service in Japan.
They told the head of the ministry's Broadcasting Bureau they would like to start a service as soon as possible, a ministry official told reporters.
In August, Murdoch's Australia-based international media conglomerate News Corp Ltd said it and Softbank hoped to start a 12-channel service using Japan's JCSAT-3 satellite.
The companies will be granted a licence for a TV service using the JCSAT-3 satellite this autumn, the ministry official said. They will be able to start services as early as next year.
The official said companies providing services using the Japanese satellite should not be foreign companies.
Softbank said in June that it would provide a new multichannel, digital satellite broadcasting service, JSky B, with News Corp through a joint venture to be set up soon in Japan.
Softbank said on June 20 that the joint venture would acquire a 21.4 percent stake in Asahi National Broadcasting Co, a major Japanese broadcaster.
